title: Take Me Out contestant attempts to break Guinness World Record
text:
Well this is different (Picture: ITV)

A Take Me Out contestant will attempt to break a Guinness World Record on Saturday night’s show – dressed as superhero ‘Captain Fantastico’.

The ITV dating show is back for its 11th series and once again host Paddy McGuinness will help a host of unlucky-in-love singletons find their perfect matches.

You know the drill – ‘no likey, no lighty’

In the love lift, this week hoping for a date to the Isle of Fernando’s are body-building stripper James, farmer Berty, gymnast Raymond and Scarlett Moffatt’s ex-boyfriend, Lee.

And it is Raymond who attempted to break the record for the most jumping-Jacks – while trying to impress the ‘Flirty Thirty’ panel.

Will he do it? (Picture: ITV)

An official Guinness World Record adjudicator took to the stage with Paddy and Raymond to go through the rules with him.

‘Raymond to get the Guinness World Record title for the most jumping-Jacks in 30 seconds your feet must go beyond shoulder width,’ he explained.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Arms above your head so that your hands touch, only valid jumping-Jacks will be counted towards the total.’

Raymond then had 30 seconds to complete the task, but in doing so a large selection of the girls turned their lights to red.

So does Raymond smash the Guinness World Record or more importantly does he get a date?

The new series of Take Me Out will air from Saturday, 7:15pm on ITV.

description: Take Me Out contestant attempts to break Guinness World Record dressed as a superhero.
